Posts.Content: Mar 25, 2017 07:17PM dAd wrote: Hi Jennihopeful: I had extracapsular extension from more than 1 node and, no, it doesn't mean there is cancer "floating around" in my body. I had both chemo and rads and I was told by all my docs that the rads were specifically to "mop up" any cancer cells still lurking around. I also had a bone scan, CT scan and MRI to check for mets. In other words, if your mother's doctors feel it's necessary, there a number of avenues they may decide to pursue

Posts.Content: Mar 12, 2017 09:28PM dAd wrote: Hi Boubou: Are you in the GTA? If so, you should find out if they are making all your records accessible online. I'm at Princess Margaret and all the UHN hospitals have records online as does Sunnybrook but I don't know about any others. In any case, you are legally entitled to your records any where in Ontario so ask for written copies if there is no other way. Good luck and let me know how you make out. Ann

Posts.Content: Nov 6, 2016 12:41PM dAd wrote: Interesting thread. However for what's worth, I think the content of The Truth About Cancer is misleading and potentially downright dangerous. This is not to say that there is no place for alternative and natural approaches to cancer treatment and I would recommend a website like Integrative Oncology which blends alternative and conventional treatments. For those who are interested here is the link: integrativeoncology-essentials...
Posts.Title: Truth about Cancer ?? dancingdiva SSInUK

Posts.Content: Jan 4, 2017 03:04PM dAd wrote: Hi Lisa: I'm so sorry you are having to face this again with the added worry of not wanting to be treated by your former surgeon. For what it's worth, when I was first diagnosed the surgeon I saw made me very uncomfortable so I asked my PCP what I should do. She suggested a surgeon (one of the top BC docs in this country) so I asked her to see if he would take me. I received a call the next day from his office and had an appointment the day after that. My surgery was two weeks later. I don't know what the protocols are in the UK but isn't there any way around what seems to be an excessively rigid system? Are you too far from London to access care there somehow? Anne
